meanings.definition: Submit (a document) for consideration or approval before the official filing date.
meanings.sent1: I need to prefile my report before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: She always likes to prefile her taxes to avoid any last-minute rush.
meanings.sent3: John decided to prefile his homework to impress his teacher.
meanings.sent4: The students were eager to prefile their project proposals to stand out.
meanings.sent5: Remember to prefile your application to secure your spot in the program.

meanings.definition: To prepare or organize (a document) for filing in advance.
meanings.sent1: Before the meeting, I prefiled the presentation slides for smooth delivery.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer always prefiles the necessary paperwork to save time.
meanings.sent3: Sarah decided to prefile her shopping list to avoid forgetting items.
meanings.sent4: The team prefiled their strategy to ensure a successful outcome.
meanings.sent5: It's wise to prefile your documents to stay organized and efficient.
